meanings.definition: Relating to or causing the development of cancer.
meanings.sent1: The oncogenic mutation led to the growth of cancer cells.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the oncogenic properties of certain genes.
meanings.sent3: The oncogenic nature of the situation made everyone nervous.
meanings.sent4: Her reckless behavior was like an oncogenic force spreading chaos.
meanings.sent5: The oncogenic impact of pollution on health cannot be ignored.

meanings.definition: Having the potential to induce the formation of tumors.
meanings.sent1: Researchers identified a new oncogenic protein in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The substance showed oncogenic effects in the animal study.
meanings.sent3: The cake's sweetness was so oncogenic, it could create a dessert tumor.
meanings.sent4: His words were like oncogenic seeds planting doubt in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The oncogenic power of radiation was evident in the experiment results.
